definition: to cause a loss of (decorum, dignity etc) (used in fixed expressions)
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
(polite) excuse me for not going out to meet you
lit. just as humans make mistakes, so can a horse stumble (idiom)/fig. everyone makes mistakes/even the best fall down sometimes
pinyin: ren2 you3 shi1 shou3 , ma3 you3 shi1 ti2

definition: lit. just as humans make mistakes, so can a horse stumble (idiom)/fig. everyone makes mistakes/even the best fall down sometimes
pinyin: ren2 you3 shi1 shou3 , ma3 you3 shi1 ti2

definition: you win some, you lose some (idiom)/gains and losses/trade-off

sentences.english: But there are trade-offs, and cloud computing is not without its warts.
sentences.chinese: 但是，有得必有失，雲計算並非沒有缺點。

sentences.english: You would not expect him actually to perform those degrading acts?
sentences.chinese: 你並不指望他真的幹出這些有失身份的事？

sentences.english: Is furthermore small and soft to calculate, queen mother this undertaking really has already lost advisability.
sentences.chinese: 再者細細推算，太后此舉委實有失明智。

sentences.english: Sun Quan, fearing for Ling Tong, ordered Lv Meng to bring him back to camp.
sentences.chinese: 孫權恐淩統有失，令呂蒙接應回營。

sentences.english: He considered such jobs beneath him.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲這種工作有失他的身份。

sentences.english: Under the influence of the school of mind, he was both successful and unsuccessful.
sentences.chinese: 在陽明心學思想影響下，他有得有失。

sentences.english: The act would be below the national dignity.
I hope you wouldn't lower yourself to cheat in the examination.
sentences.chinese: 希望你考試不要作弊，別做有失身份的事。

sentences.english: It would be unfair, of course, to see all Chinese companies in this light.
sentences.chinese: 當然，一棍子打死所有中國企業的做法有失公平。

sentences.english: It is beneath him to grumble.
The perception that people have of chess players and boxers is slightly warped at either end of the spectrum.
sentences.chinese: 人們對棋手和拳擊手的看法都有失偏頗。

sentences.english: Win a few, lose a few. That's life。
sentences.chinese: 有得也有失，生活就是如此。

sentences.english: I won‘t argue with you, but I think you’re being unfair.
sentences.chinese: 我不和你爭論，不過我認爲你有失公允。

sentences.english: He was not a very nice man in many ways.
sentences.chinese: 他的許多做法都有失妥當。

sentences.english: Happiness is unafraid accused prince private into jin wang pay beneath etiquette.
sentences.chinese: 如意卻是毫無懼意指責太子私入晉王付有失禮節。

sentences.english: Charity is as bad as brigandage. Charity is really just as unfair to the recipient as to the donor.
sentences.chinese: 施捨和掠奪一樣可惡，對捐獻者和接受者都有失公平。

definition: to hand someone the swordhilt (idiom)/to give someone a hold on oneself
lit. to go to war without just cause (idiom)/to act without justification
to make oneself an object of ridicule
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
to not conform to/to be unsuited to/to be out of keeping with/should not/ought out
